A few things to know:
--The windows on the first floor open to sidewalks, and pedestrians have a clear view into the house. Closing the blinds is required for privacy, like living in a cave.
--If over 5'10" tall, you will bump your head on the ceiling in a couple of places
--There are two comfortable chairs in the house-both are in the ubstairs bedroom. The downstairs sofa in the dining room is small and stiff.
Otherwise, the place is nicely decorated, clean, and has a great location. Our dogs loved the convenience of a fenced yard.

Stayed with a pet
review_text: Right in the heart of Silver City's downtown. Quiet at night but regular sidewalk and street traffic during the day. Lots to bark at for our dogs in the secure yard. The food co-op is literally half a block away, restaurants right across the street as well as through the rest of downtown. Easy parking. Comfortable beds. Not a lot of couch/lounge space. Overall a great place to stay while visiting Silver City and environs.

name: Bob
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Teachers' Cottage was a great place to stay while exploring Silver City. Well-appointed, convenient location, super comfortable. GREAT pizza place (Forrest's) and bakery (Diane's) right across the street, Roxy's diner around the corner, Little Toad Creek Brewery and Distillery a few blocks away, lots of art galleries and other restaurants along Bullard Street. Took a nice stroll along the Big Ditch (stream/park a block away) - be sure to check out the fascinating tile mural in the park that describes how floods in the late 19th / early 20th century turned Main Street into the Big Ditch. HIGHLY recommend exploring Gila Cliff Dwellings at the end of route 15 north of town. It's about 1.5 hours to get there (windy mountain road) but well worth the effort; it's a national monument, but there's no fee.

My family and I loved staying here! We appreciated all the touches and decor put into this historic home’s renovation! Such love and care has been given to everything. You have the benefit of the historic character with modern amenities—the bathrooms and kitchen have chic, new fixture and appliances. The beds and blankets were super cozy and comfortable.
If you want to be in the heart of historic Silver City to walk to restaurants, cafes, bookstores, galleries, and shops—this is the place for you. Be sure to hit them all on Saturday because Sunday and Monday is a ghost town.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Traveling with a dog can be tiring, especially to new places. The teachers cottage was a dream! not only was it super private, I parked right in front and let the pup out to play while unpacking. You are less than 2 minutes walk from pizza, an adorable coop grocery (with cute gifts -when Birdwells is closed) and 5 min walk to the local bar (Alexander is an amazing bartender!)
From basking in a quiet private yard to enjoying the decor, I was happy to splurge on this space instead of risking a hotel. There was little foot traffic and I saw only dogs on leash. There's a gorgeous "ditch park" river walk at the very end of this street and an off leash dog park 6 min drive. Be sure to check out The coffee shop around the corner but plan ahead, the line was long (for a reason!). Spend the extra cash and you will be glad you did!

AirBNB
We loved the cottage. It is one of the cleanest AirBNBs I have ever rented. I almost always have to give the coffee pot a proper cleaning. Not here! Floors and furniture were spotless. We appreciated the thick towels and comfy bedding. Kimber was very attentive to our needs with wonderful and easy communication. Shopping and restaurants were across the street. name: Katharine
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

·
May 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a historic, adobe home that has been lovingly restored with modern conveniences. It's absolutely adorable. The upstairs room has two double beds, a full bath, and a sitting/ work area. With all the windows and the compact space it feels like a treehouse. The downstairs bedroom has a Murphy bed, and a door that opens to a tidy, well kept enclosed yard with a swing, two rocking chairs, and a table with an umbrella. This place has a lot of character, and it's right in the historic district so everything is within walking distance. Keep in mind that it is a small space. My brother is 6'4", so none of the beds, or the sloped ceilings upstairs were comfortable for him. The rest of us are under 5'10" and we thought it was a great place in an arty, laid-back, friendly town. We can't wait to go back.

review_text: Thank you Kimber! The Teacher’s Cottage was a perfect place to retreat to. We loved this historical home with all of it’s special finishing touches. We felt right at home with comfy beds, clean bathrooms and kitchen. Everything we needed was supplied. It was perfect for our two little dogs too! We also appreciated that everything we wanted to do was in walking distance. Wonderful experience!I’m looking forward to staying again.

name: Laura
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
How to begin. The Teacher's Cottage was more than I expected. Beautiful inside and out. The light from the windows, the yard and sitting area - was full of sunshine.
It was within walking distance of a beautiful main street, full of artisans and co-op food grocery. Walking distance! I adored Silver City and The Teacher's Cottage was a dream.
A downstairs bedroom and full bath and upstairs in the loft two queens and a full bath. The showers were fantastic and kitchen exceptionally appointed. What I found lovely was the large dining room table where we ate and played cards.
A wonderful place to come together with friends and family. Our host was proactive and positive. Her catalog of places was wonderful. Tranquil Buzz coffee shop is not to be missed. And we had fun at the Buckthorn Saloon and Opera house.
I worry about telling the world about this place because it is so wonderful. I would stay again in a heartbeat. It was perfect.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Lovely historic home in the heart of old town, walkable to all of the shops, galleries, and restaurants. Beds were comfortable and I slept great. Due to the location, there is some noise during the day, loud trucks and motorcycles mostly but it was quiet for sleeping. Downstairs is a large bedroom with queen bed and tv. A full bath is just next to the bedroom off the living room. Upstairs is more of a loft type suite with 2 beds and a full bath. There is no off-street parking but I always had a close parking option. My only suggestion would be to have a sofa and more comfortable furniture in the living room area instead of just the large table and period piece chairs. Overall it was enjoyable and convenient. I would recommend it.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We totally enjoyed the accommodations - centrally located to downtown SilverCity, NM. Cozy and well maintained. The downstairs bedroom has a Murphy's bed which surprisingly was comfortable. First floor bathroom was well stocked with plenty of soft absorbent towels as well as large size toiletries (shampoo, conditioner and body wash). The wooden table was perfect for playing card games and enjoying conversation with a glass of wine. Each room has several windows with easy to operate blinds (as privacy may be an issue with the sidewalks close to the cottage). Overall our stay was pleasant and wished we had booked it for an additional day.

name: Michael
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a quiet, peaceful place to stay. Just 10 minutes from Silver City, but it felt rural and private. The original artwork and retro furnishings gave it a nice homey feel. The traditional adobe style architecture mostly worked to keep the house comfortably warm but we were grateful for the supplemental heater during our February stay. Beds were small (full? queen?) but comfortable. We were surprised and gratified to discover it had Internet (when we booked it, the description indicated it didn't). Indeed had we known this, we likely would have stayed here for our entire time in Silver City. We relocated to another local place for the remainder of our 4 week stay because we needed Internet for some time sensitive business. host was immediately responsive and helpful. All communication was clear and timely. If peace, solitude and quiet in a comfortable house is what you seek, this is the place for you.

name: Christina
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2024
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
This is a beautiful home and we felt so comfortable and at peace here. The house and its decor feel so purposeful and honest. The kitchen is very well equipped, as are the bedrooms. The location is unbeatable, with a view of the sunset over the surrounding hills that seems to last for hours. We had planned to spend more time in the actual old town of Silver City but just really enjoyed being here in this house surrounded by natural beauty.
We did enjoy a trip to Faywood Hot Springs about half an hour away, ate delicious crispy pizza at Whiskey Zocalo, bought some affordable art at the local artists’ guild, plus some very fun pottery from Animalia.
Our dog liked it here too, and it’s nice that Silver City is pretty dog friendly. We definitely plan to come back for a longer visit next time!

name: Karla
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: Five stars! Excellent Wi-Fi, super comfy bed, everything in good repair, and lovingly curated with modern art made by the owner/managers/friends, plus unique vintage decor. Our dogs felt at home instantly—always a good sign! Terrific location to see the Gila cliff dwellings, City of Rocks and The Catwalk. The daily trip to town for vegan Food Co-op sandwiches seemed to take us 5 minutes. Wranglers Bar & Grill and Little Toad Creek Brewery were also handy from the house—we were SO glad we didn’t stay in a hotel. Many thoughtful touches throughout this hand crafted, double walled adobe home that was built to last forever. No microwave ( most dinnerware is handmade) but the Instant Pot’s steam function can reheat many foods, as well as cook. In short, everything you need for a delightful stay is here :)

review_text: Wonderful house. Great place to relax and appreciate the scenery but only a few minutes from downtown. Plenty of spaces inside and out to spread out. Awesome star show after dark and we had a pair of duetting great horned owls each night. If you’re into nature, I saw 20+ species of birds in the yard at a kind of slow time of year. And the kitchen has everything you need—from making morning coffee to a full meal. Food co-op in town has a nice selection of organics and other good stuff. Jamie was an awesome host, always responsive. Highly recommend.

name: Patrick

Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This is a beautiful little place. My wife and I shared it with my parents and we enjoyed the floor plan very much. The bedrooms are set up like separate quarters, so there is a nice level of privacy. The open kitchen /living room floor plan is wonderful. We were all able to collaborate on our cooking projects and converse while lounging about reading. The only issue we had was that the level of cleanliness was not what it should have been. We found pet hair on the coffee table surfaces, food particles on the kitchen counters, and neither of the bathrooms were clean. It wasn't dirty to a level of being disgusting, but it wasn't what you expect when you've been charged a cleaning fee. I communicated these issues to Jamie and he was apologetic, but did not offer to refund the cleaning fee, which surprised me a bit.
Despite needing to do our own cleaning, we really enjoyed our stay. We spent a lot of time on the back patio and saw corvids, quail, hummingbirds, a deer, and other wildlife.
We enjoyed the quiet. We were never annoyed by dogs barking, engine noises, etc.
Pros: Great interior layout and decor, good kitchen, quiet, comfortable
Con: Somewhat unclean.

review_text: Well-appointed adobe home with wonderful sunset views. Lots of thoughtful amenities. Bedding was quite comfortable. Fully stocked modern kitchen (except microwave) so we had all we needed! Check-in/out is very easy. Owner communicates well and quickly. A detailed user manual is provided which was very helpful. There was great food and lots of nature to enjoy - this was my first trip to the area so I was pleasantly surprised. TIPS - We went in March and the winds were quite high so come prepared! Check NOAA.gov for hourly wind forecast - it was spot on. Sunrise Espresso and Don Juan Burritos are highly recommended! Javalina was also excellent. This was a great weekend getaway - thanks Jamie & Daniel!

About as centrally located as you can be for walking around the fun historic downtown. Wish we could have stayed longer!

name: David
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2024
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: I thoroughly enjoyed my 6 weeks at the Cozy Cabin. It's close enough to town to run in anytime for restaurants or groceries yet out of town just enough to feel private and secluded. In the yard I saw, mule deer, rabbits, quail, a road runner. It was a great space for me. I set up a desk to use as a home office. The kitchen is spacious and well equipped. The bathroom is large. Jan is very quick to respond when needed but otherwise you have your private space. She took care of the garbage and brought mail and packages I received. When I needed a chair she went and bought two new ones. The proximity to the Gila Wilderness was the main attraction for me. There was plenty of fishing and an incredible amount of hiking trails. Lot's of wildlife. Other sites nearby are City of Boulders state park, White Sand National Park, Cave Dwellings National Monument and the Catwalk. Lots of hot springs too.

The front porch is lovely with beautifully clean and attractive cushions on the rocking chairs. There is also an outside patio adjacent to the cabin with table and chairs (again with spotless cushions) for dining in warmer weather. Good internet access. Very comfortable. We have already booked a return stay in May. Highly recommended.

We had a restful retreat here for our anniversary weekend ~ a welcome oasis at the end of a long journey from Texas.
It's a serene spot where bodies can settle, minds can still, hearts can open and spirits can soar.
It truly is a COZY CABIN in every sense of the word.
Bless the hosts who set the stage so beautifully, bless the travelers who find their way here safely, and bless Silver City for sprinkling its undeniable magic over this whole area.

We saw a doe and fawn immediately upon arrival, and later a half-dozen or more deer including three fawns. Jan's freshly baked cookies, waiting on the kitchen counter, were delicious! Full kitchen, coffee and coffee maker, wifi, comfy bed and rocking chairs on the front porch, plus outdoor table and grill, though we did not grill. Whenever we are in the Silver City area, if we need lodging, we will be checking to see if this wonderful place is available. Thank you, Jan and Lew!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

·

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
What a great place this is! It's located several hundred yards up off the street up a gravel road, and because it sits on a hill, there's a nice view of the hills to the northeast and the meadow below the cabin. We sat on the porch for hours and watched deer in the meadow (they ambled up to within twenty yards of the cabin to drink), and we watched the hummingbirds at the feeder in the tree by the porch in addition to watching goldfinches, quail, rabbits, and bluejays. It was SO peaceful!
The cabin is a studio with a very comfortable queen-size bed, a TV with DISH satellite service, a fully-furnished kitchen, and a nice bathroom.
Jan, the owner, lives in a house on the property, and she is very nice. She had homemade lemon bars for us in the cabin when we arrived.
I give this place my highest rating!

name: Marcela
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
December 2021
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: I stayed at the cozy cabin in late September, October, & November. I had a perfect Verizon signal. I saw quail, roadrunners, javelina, rabbits, and deer right outside the cabin. The stars were spectacular. The cabin has lots of natural light and is fairly well insulated. The window AC unit worked well when temps were in the low 80s. Two small space heaters warm up the cabin. The 700 sq ft cabin's open floor plan had plenty of room for this solo traveler. The full kitchen is similar to the size of a small apartment kitchen and was very comfortable for me. The cabin is surrounded by homes on three sides (including the hosts' house) but beautiful alligator juniper & oak trees provide privacy. I rarely heard the neighbors. My dog barked at the dozens of partly domesticated and almost fearless deer that permanently reside on the property. The hosts were warm, welcoming, and receptive to feedback.

review_text: A lovely house with a great location one block north of Rt 180. We walked into town from the house and window shopped one evening. The house is super clean with everything you need. Nice linens, lots of light quilts to layer as needed. We hate duvets (either too hot or too cold, and we wonder if the host ever washes them), so were glad to see the quilts. We appreciate the Brita filter, central heat, gated, fenced yard and dishwasher. The porch looks like an inviting place to hang out, but it was a little too cold (February) and we had too much business to attend to on this trip. We left a few books for the lending library. There are also a few games. We played our guitar and mandolin one night, and we weren't loud, but we didn't need to worry about bothering anyone. The only thing I would want to change would be the bed. It needs a sturdier frame so it doesn't jiggle and wake one of us up when we turn over or get in and out. If that could be fixed, we would be delighted to return.

The inside of the house is colorfully decorated with a nice sized bathroom. The bathroom and kitchen are well-appointed with many of the necessities for bathing and cooking. There are a few live plants in the house on which Colette had placed ornaments and/or lights to make the living room and kitchen festive for the holidays!! Colette is a very pleasant person and a great host. When we find our way back to Silver City again, Colette's place will be our first choice of places to stay.

review_text: Great location to explore all that Silver City and its environs has to offer. Very quiet setting yet close enough for a walk into town for coffee, beer, food, stores, art galleries, university, and more. Very comfortable living space with plenty of light during the day – good reading lights at night. Well equipped kitchen for short or long-term stays. Private garden setting to relax after days of sightseeing or hiking. Nice large dining table that can double as a desk for remote working. We spent a month and would love to stay again. Host was very responsive and great to chat with too.

review_text:
Great spot, really roomy and comfortable for two of us (with room for more if we’d been traveling with others). Loved the art and colorful decor. Quiet and peaceful—if the weather had been warmer we would have enjoyed hanging out on the deck. So convenient to have laundry too.
Silver City has much to recommend it— nice shops/galleries, great food co-op, tasty food (Jalisco’s is great). We explored a bit of Boston Hill for in town hiking—lots more options outside town we’ll have to check out next time.
Excellent visitors center—great place for ideas for EVERYTHING in the area—history, museums, events, activities, food. The manager was a wealth of information. Also the university (WNMU) has an outstanding collection of Mimbres pottery.
Colette’s place was a wonderful place to rest and relax while taking in Silver City’s many riches! Highly recommended.

There are several pleasant outdoor spaces at Colette's that we loved, and the neighborhood is off the beaten path and quiet. There is also a small but nice botanical garden to explore just a short walk away. Colette is a very sweet and responsive host. Highly recommended, and we hope to be back one day!

review_text: Colette’s house was perfect for our needs. The location is just right for walking to town, yet very quiet at night for good sleeping! This house has two outdoor spaces- one shared with Colette’s house, and a private one in back- we used both. The outdoor spaces have lovely landscaping and the neighborhood is surrounded by large trees. The rental itself is very comfortable- comfortable furniture and beds. The kitchen has all manner of cooking utensils and made for very easy meal preparation. Although the home is cheerfully and artfully decorated, it wasn’t “over-done”. (We have stayed at rentals that had WAY too much decor you had to move to function). There is no TV, but we would rather not have one. Colette is very quick to respond to correspondence and her rental is reasonably priced. We will stay here again the next time we visit Silver City.

review_text: Colette's place is even better than the pictures. There are a few different areas for enjoying a meal, cup of coffee or just soaking up the beauty and peace and quiet of her yard, including a private back patio. The beds are comfy and shower has good water pressure. There are shelves in the bathroom which provide plenty of room for everyone's toiletries. The kitchen is stocked with all that you need for making meals, coffee and tea. We had a couple of changes in our schedule. Colette was quick to respond and patient with us. If you like peace and quiet, but still want to be close to downtown, hiking trails and points of interest, this is your place. We look forward to returning!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
"Quiet Escape in Town" is a perfect description for this lovely lodging, located on a dead-end lane across from a protected green belt with tall trees. The host's home is on the same property, but we hardly knew she was there. Privacy fences shield the view of other nearby houses. Prepare to be enchanted while sitting on the front porch or patio!
We were charmed upon walking into the large, bright living/dining/kitchen area which features eclectic decor and artwork, as well as comfy furnishings. The kitchen was well-equipped with everything we needed. Comfortable beds, spacious closets, and a handy washer/dryer unit made things easy. We look forward to staying here again!

name: Nirva
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I highly recommend this spot! The space was in a quiet part of town which made our stay so relaxing. And it was close to highways and downtown, making it convenient for sight-seeing.
The downtown area is so cute and transports you to another era. People in Silver City are so warm and welcoming. I’ve never felt so comfortable walking around exploring town.
The space itself is amazing. It’s decorated in a comfy and eclectic style. The home is equipped with full amenities (laundry, full kitchen, Keurig, porches). The rooms are spacious with plenty of storage. And we loved sitting out on the porch, listening to the cicadas sing and walking through the neighborhood to stargaze.
Colette herself is super friendly and hospitable. I’d recommend her and this space.

name: Clint

,

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is an incredibly nice place to stay. We enjoyed quiet mornings having breakfast on the porch surrounded by delightful native landscaping and bird life, and chatting with friends in the evening (there is a second secluded porch on the opposite side of the house as well). The house itself has everything you could want. The dinnerware is all high quality and ample, everything was spotless clean. The bed in the master bedroom is queen sized and of moderate firmness and quiet comfortable. I'm a light sleeper, and really appreciated how incredibly quiet the house is at night. Artwork throughout the house is varied and interesting. Colette is a really nice host, and was accessible if we needed anything, but left us to ourselves otherwise. When leaving, I had forgotten an item and she was more than accommodating in arranging for a friend of mine that lives in the area to swing by and pick it up. We will be visiting Silver City off and on in the future now that friends live there, and I know we have a 'home away from home' with Colette's AirBnB. Five stars all the way.

review_text: We recently planned a visit to see a friend in Silver City who recently opened up a new art gallery. After searching properties in the downtown historic district, we decided on “Quiet Place In Town” since we needed 2 separate bedrooms for 3 of us. We were greeted by Johanna when we arrived and she made sure we had everything we needed. The lovely home was very well stocked with towels, bedding, kitchen tools and even some non perishable food items. The layout was great. Nice large kitchen with dishwasher and the beds were comfortable. Clean and spacious bathroom. Colette made sure we always had an open line of communication available. We really enjoyed our stay here and would love to come back again. Silver City is a hidden gem and “Quiet Place In Town” is the place to stay! Thank you Colette and Johanna.

It’s located in a quiet, residential neighborhood, has good privacy and has convenient parking. The apartment is comfortable and well laid out, with a large, clean bathroom, well stocked kitchen and comfortable sitting area. There is also outdoor seating though we didn’t use it since the weather was cool. The beds are comfortable but you may want to bring a book light if you plan to read in bed. Our only concern was that we found the WiFi signal to be weak and sometimes had difficulty connecting to it. Overall, we were very happy with our stay.

rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I was very excited to see this place available for a few days after having wanted to stay here for a number of years! Previously, it has always being booked during my trips to Silver (until now.) The architecture of the structure is very unique and welcoming. The Casita was quiet.
However, I had a very difficult time breathing during our trip due to a strong mold smell. There was obvious water damage above the bed. I am personally tired of paying high cleaning fees for air b n bs that are not clean upon check in, specifically, this place had hair in the shower and was very dusty/musty.
I was so looking forward to this stay and was disappointed that I had to manage my normally well controlled asthma and got little sleep when I had a busy slate of work and job interviews lined up for Friday.
If you are looking for a quiet, restful, cute place with an attentive host this could be for you; IF you don't have any breathing challenges.

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
I hate to start with a negative but I am surprised that no one else posted about the bug infestation inside the casita. It is out of control! There were dead and living roaches, spiders, and various bugs inside the space. It was rather unsettling. We are outdoorsy and spent 5 days camping after our stay. We encountered more bugs inside the airbnb than we did camping! If bugs make you squeamish and you’re not looking for an earthy experience, this probably isn’t the place for you.
Otherwise, the airbnb is conveniently located and in walking distance to restaurants, coffee shops, and hiking trails.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We initially chose the Art House because of its location and extremely reasonable per night rental fee. We will return to the Art House because it was better than advertised, well appointed, beautifully decorated, and has the perfect in town location.
The kitchen was organized and well stocked with all the necessary culinary tools, pots and pans, and dishes. The bathroom towels are oversized, thirsty, and plentiful. The full size washer and dryer looked brand new and laundry detergent was provided (and not rationed). The queen size mattress is comfortable and the sheets were soft.
We were very happy at the Art House for our week long stay and will definitely book it again next year when we return for The Tour of the Gila.

We loved waking up to the sunshine against the tall trees from bedroom windows. And the well-stocked kitchen, living room, and sun room are also nice spaces to spend time in. The host has arranged everything in a tasteful and attractive way. All told, the house makes an ideal base from which to soak up all the wonders of Silver City and its natural environs. Highly recommended!

review_text: My stay at Alex and Mileidy's apartment was perfection. The space is fantastic. The Walton is a lovely, well-located, historic complex and the apartment is delightful. It's been meticulously restored, immaculately maintained, and beautifully decorated. Alex and Mileidy are generous, thoughtful hosts, who obviously care a lot about their guests' experience. The place was spotless, the farm fresh eggs they left were delicious, and chatting with Alex was super fun. I honestly can't say enough about my stay. Highly recommend!

review_text: The Walton Apartments has been lovingly restored. Allessandro and his wife have paid attention to every detail in preserving this landmark building. The apartment is perfect for one or two people and gives a sense of what a small affordable dwelling from the late 1920s was like. I especially liked the original finishes, the cross breezes that kept its temperature perfect and the quiet provided by the adobe walls.

review_text:
We'd reserved an earlier date and easily were able to receive confirmation of a new date with an indication from Alessandro that the weather would be better. We arrived and found, inside the apartment, great information on Silver City.
We decided to name the apartment "Grandma's Place." No disrespect... it's just that the apartment has been perfectly restored to the 1950's, with of course, new appliences including a new washer/dryer on the property.
Parking was private, off street, and if Alessandro is around and you're a motor head as am I, have him show you his Italian motor bike collection as well as his antique Fiat truck. Don't miss it.
Alessandro's place is one of the best experiences we've had with vacation rentals.

The leather sofa and arm chair in the living room were super inviting, the bed was nicely made up with cotton linens, and the dining nook in the kitchen was perfect. The area is very nice, quiet and safe, and a short walk to Silver City's historic downtown area for great coffee shops, bakery, galleries, book stores, etc. Alex met us when we arrived and was so helpful in telling us about things to do in the area. We hope to visit again soon!

It is within walking distance to the quaint downtown area with several delightful restaurants, pubs, coffee spots, many terrific art galleries and antique shops.
We will come back and do more exploring and look forward to staying at Alessandro and Mileidy’s sweet apartment.

This unit is in a group of similar others but neighbours were quiet and friendly.
An easy and delightful walk into town.
Kitchen counter space for meal preparation can be challenging but the kitchen table solves any issues in this department.
Thank you for a wonderful introduction into 1930s architecture and Silver City.

I loved Alessandro’s place. He’s so thoughtfully rehabbed these beautiful old apartments, made clever use of the space and decorated very stylishly.
There’s loads of reading material about the history of the area in addition to useful maps and things. The kitchen is great, the nook is nice and bright and there are a few design ideas in there that I’ll use in my own little place back home!
I visited in August, and while there is an AC wall unit in the kitchen, I never needed to use it if I closed windows/doors during the day and opened up at night. There are ceiling fans in all the rooms and good screens on all the doors and windows.
I was worried that I’d hear neighbors or disturb them w my own noise, but it was lovely and quiet.
I’d absolutely love to stay here again. Thank u Alessandro!

Also the sauce pans in the kitchen were corroded and deteriorated and should be replaced.

name: Jc
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

May 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: The Walton Apartments are a really cool example of thoughtful, elegant, low-key mid-century/deco-inflected design. The decor is true to the vintage era with many fun touches of a particularly New Mexican flavor. The grounds are charming and full of friendly birds, and the location is great. It was a pleasant, easy walk to the main drag in town where the galleries, food co-op, restaurants and coffee spots can be found. We didn't have time to explore the gardens at WNMU, which are directly across the street, but it was nice to have the university, and the delightful public library, as neighbors. If you're looking for outdoor and cultural activities, Alessandro has thoughtfully curated all sorts of guides. I wish we had been able to stay longer than one night and will definitely be back again.

The lodging is well equipped for an extended stay and is in a private quiet location near the University campus. A real Silver City gem!

review_text: Alessandro's place is very nice. It is right across the street from Western NM Univ and its wonderful Museum of southwestern Native artifacts. Downtown Silver City is a short walk and even shorter drive away. The place is spotless and spacious for one traveler. Well equipped kitchen with a nook that works well for working remotely. The biggest positive for me is that Alessandro lives nearby and is super responsive (responds in minutes), something I highly value in AirBNB rentals. The only downside is that heating is controlled centrally, i.e. the temperature cannot be adjusted. I was able to adjust the temperature to my liking by opening windows for a short period of times...that may bother others but did not bother me.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Alessandro's apartment and very much appreciated meeting him and having him come by to show us through. Much attention has been paid to making the space welcoming, attractive, functional and clean. Many of the original aspects of the apartment have been restored, and having done that sort of work ourselves we recognize the effort required to achieve it. It is lovely. It was also very quiet and peaceful.
The apartment has everything you might need to settle in, cook, and make yourself at home. We travel with a box of things like a sharp knife, condiments, a stick free frying pan, tissues, extra toilet paper, etc. Did not need anything from the “box”!
And the location is ideal. It's in easy walking distance to the university and downtown. We especially like the Western New Mexico University Museum. It has an outstanding collection of pottery – really outstanding, and it's just up the hill. Restaurants, groceries, shops – all nearby. We hope to be back again soon.

We visited The City of Rocks State Park after reading about it in the guidebook, and loved it. Thanks, Alessandro for taking the time to provide such a great experience for your guests.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The apartment is perfect for 2 people. Even though there is a trundle bed in the living room, it would be crowded for 3 adults but perhaps a child would be OK. The place was spotless and very well cared for. The kitchen is well-stocked, there is an espresso maker and some coffee, and some wonderful fresh eggs. Alex was available if we needed anything. Even though Silver City does not recycle, he let us know that we could save our recycling items and he would pick them up and deliver to the recycling site. Highly recommended. Also, recommend Revel restaurant - not the usual run-of-the mill menu, good wine list and great, friendly staff. They offer a 3-course dinner with several food options, and it was difficult to make a choice. Everything was fresh and tasty. Also, found lunch at Little Toad Creek Brewery to be excellent - and friendly, efficient staff.

review_text:
One of the great things about Cherie's place is that, although it's in a local neighborhood, the peaceful and secluded setting gives one a true sense of solitude. Very quiet. Plenty of land between for much privacy. The only down-side was there was a bit of nearby road construction going on at the time of our visit. Of course, Cherie couldn't control that and that is only a temporary thing, anyway. And from the guest-house there was no tell-tell signs, no noise, no dust, nothing. The huge cottonwood trees that line the creek, which is just a few yards away, was great to have for bird watching as we sat outdoors to enjoy morning coffee. And, being just a few minutes from town was also a plus.
Cherie was a great host. Ever available but not intrusive. Thanks, Cherie, for making this trip a nice getaway.

review_text: This lovely free standing casita is a perfect get away. It is so close to town yet feels like it is in the country. Quail, hummingbirds, rabbits and birds abound. The house is completely functional so you can get cook, rest, work and relax in privacy while still having Cherie right up the hill. We have stayed at many homes over the years and I don't remember ever feeling more at home and comfortable. It is wonderful.

name: Laura
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2023
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: The High Lonesome Guesthouse and the surrounding property exceeded all my expectations. Pictures don't do it justice and it was exactly the kind of break I needed from everyday life! From the moment I booked the guesthouse, Cherie let me know not to hesitate to ask if there was anything I needed. She is 4 miles outside of Silver City and a great middle point for all the surrounding trails, and national parks. I felt like I was living in my little slice of heaven for the 9 days I was there and left feeling uplifted, relaxed and like I had a new friend. Thanks for sharing your beautiful place, including High Lonesome Book Store, with me! Truly a hidden gem.

We had a very busy and emotional task we had to take care of, and being able to come back to a place that was comfortable and quiet was priceless. Seeing all the wildlife and hearing the windblowing through the trees early in the morning was amazing. If you are in Silver City, book Cherie's place!

We saw wildlife, heard some peaceful music in the distance and loved it there. We will definitely make our way back here again.
If it was possible to do a 5+ star rating we would.

My stay provided a genuine refuge at a time when I sorely needed it. I feel fortunate.

It's very close to the Gomez Peak trail network (5 min) and yet only a few miles to Silver City's historic downtown. Cherie thought of everything one would need when settling into a guest home. I settled in and felt right at home. This place is perfect for a quiet couples weekend getaway or a peaceful extended stay for a traveling professional.

The Guest House is spacious enough & equipped but the beds are both tired and one absolutely needs replaced/repaired.

The creek was easy to cross in my Jeep and Cherie was great in letting me know how it looked, before I headed down, so I could determine what car to bring! I highly recommend Cherie’s place for a peaceful stay close to town.

name: Nancy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2017
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We found the location of Cherie's guest house to be just wonderful. It is only a few minutes from Silver City, yet it is out in the country, where there is no noise and beautiful evening skies.
The cottage had everything you could possibly need for a short stay, or an extended stay. We actually cooked a modest Thanksgiving dinner and had two friends over. The fresh turkey breast came out great.
The place is clean and fully stocked with anything you might need. I had forgotten my shampoo and conditioner, and was happy with the choices Cherie had. Also, I am often bothered by the strong smells that soaps and shampoos generally have, but Cherie had hypoallergenic soap in the bathroom, a huge plus.
The one issue I had was a bed with less support and firmness than I would have liked. But, I am 69 and have a lower back issue, so that might have exacerbated the fact that the bed was not supportive to me. Certainly we would stay there again, as the couch was very comfortable for me, and my partner did fine in the bed without me there.

review_text: This property was just what we hoped for--quiet and peaceful. It was charming and had lovely sitting areas outside. The guest house was decorated with some very nice original artwork, and the book selection included several volumes by one of the owners. One was a very well written saga of a trip down the Gila river with his dog and a tomcat--and I had to get a copy. Cherie kindly had it autographed for us. The guest house is in the country, but just a few minutes from Silver City. We had a lovely time and would definitely stay here again!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Cherie's guest house and property is beautiful and conveniently located just minutes from historic downtown Silver City and the university. The guest house nicely accommodated three of us. The property is quiet and peaceful. The zero light pollution allows for great star gazing and the deer come right up to the house to graze. The house had everything in the event you forgot something and the fridge was stocked with bottled water. I recommend this place to anyone traveling to Silver City. You won't be disappointed.

name: Monica L
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

May 2016
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Cute, self-sufficient, very quiet, very clean 2BR cottage. It is near a creek, which makes for good birdwatching. Comfortable chairs all around the porch to sit and enjoy the morning and evening. The pleasant climate and slow pace of Silver City also make this a great getaway. Cherie runs a bookshop and small press, and the bookshop in back of their main house - floor-to-ceiling with Western, Americana, outdoors, hunting/fishing, and regional history books - new, used, out-of-print - is a gem! We enjoyed talking with Cherie and her husband about their press and bookstore, and her husband's own non-fiction and fiction works set in the region.

I woke to see quail and mule deer in the yard and the area was quiet and restful. My three-day stay exceeded my expectations.

review_text: Cherie's place was wonderful. It has everything you need to feel right at home. The location is gorgeous. It's convienant to Silver City and to The Gila National Forest area. She was very good at communicating and made some good suggestions for where to eat, etc. I would certainly recommend it to anyone visiting the area.

What a wonderful, wonderful place!!!! We enjoyed everything from the grounds to the beds. The kitchen and bathroom were well-stocked and it was great to have a full kitchen and washer and dryer.
Our doggie loved being a part of the "pack" and enjoyed romping with Dutch and Cherie's fun doggies. A touch of snow made the trip very sweet for the holidays. Peaceful, warm, plenty of room and just plain wonderful. Highly recommend spending time at High Lonesome. Fabulous hosts!

Cherie was extremely helpful with great directions for my son, who had to drive up after school and arrived well after dark.

The house is located in a beautiful area, very peaceful and quiet, yet only a short drive from Silver City. As I mentioned, she has provided some of the best directions I've ever encountered. There is a relaxed, casual aura to the whole place that envelopes you.

It's so fun to have a small house like this, instead of a hotel, when traveling with family. Having a common area for casual visiting is priceless . We had such a great time sitting on the porch, drinking coffee in the morning. Cherie's friendly, smiling dog kept polite, unobtrusive company with us.

To borrow one of Theodore Roosevelt's favorite phrases, "I was deeelighted!", with the accommodations.

They were similarly prompt in answering and questions and concerns and proactive in anticipating our needs. My family and I felt very comfortable. It was lovely.

Guests must try the amazing food at the Curious Kumquat restaurant after exploring the Gila Wilderness! I will definitely be back.

The perfect distance from Silver City, you can be in town in less than 10 minutes but get to enjoy the quiet and beauty of the desert (be sure to look at the stars!). Excellent hospitality; Cherie had truly thought of everything to make our stay comfortable. The house was very well stocked and the washer and dryer were a big bonus traveling with kids. We can't wait until we can return.

The High Lonesome Guest House is cute, small but comfortable. We stayed with 4 people and really enjoyed it.

We arrived later at night. Cherie left the door unlocked, some lights and heating on and let us do our thing. She checked in with us later in the weekend.

The creek that needs to be crossed was no issue at all for our minivan. On foot, it was easy to walk across some rocks to get to the house.

We had a good time and would definitely stay again if we travel to Silver City.

review_text: This was by far the cleanest airbnb I've ever stayed in! Beautifully decorated and well stocked. What we enjoyed the most was the privacy and peaceful mornings/evenings on the covered front porch. The bed was extremely comfortable, there was a sleeper sofa in the LR and all of the amenities in the kitchen/BR. The house had plenty of books, tourist info. and movies/games. It is situated just a few minutes outside of Silver City, so it is very quiet, yet close enough to town for a quick meal or shopping. The dragonfly hiking trail is within walking distance and easy enough for anyone to walk or bike. We were extremely pleased with our stay and would definitely stay again. Highly recommend! Thanks Donna!

review_text: We had a great stay! It was extremely clean and very comfortable. I loved how she went above and beyond in the little details. She provided coffee/tea/hot chocolate, there were board games, and she even had out candle heaters we could turn on for a great smell. It was close to where we needed to be and we loved the firefly theme throughout which we think was inspired by a nearby petroglyph hike. the neighbors are a bit close but we didn't see them at all. There were roosters crowing in the morning but I needed to wake up around then anyways. a homeless person did ask for a cigarette while we were packing up, which was my only complaint. I would definitely love to come back again in the future if I need to come back to town

Stayed with a pet
review_text: We really enjoyed our stay at Donna's place. It was our first visit to the area, and there were several things about her place that simplified things for us. She was really close to a main road, and that made getting around much easier. Second, she was very close to places to shop, so we weren't wandering around everywhere trying to locate retail shops. Third, there was a really cool trailhead just down the street from her place where we could walk our dogs and take in the natural beauty of Silver City. With the beauty and convenience of her place, plus the fact that it was so clean and pleasant and had everything we needed, we would certainly return. If you are looking for an out of the way, but convenient, clean place with a responsive host, you will love Donna's place! PS I really want to give special thanks to Donna, who offered to extend our check-out when one of our pets required emergency vet care. This was above and beyond, and we are so glad we had her support!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The space was great and this part of town is surprisingly quiet at night. There is some traffic out front in the early evening and early morning but nothing at all busy. The seating area/living room was very nice with a microwave, fridge, & plenty of room. The bedroom is spacious with a great view out front and the bathroom is small but surprisingly bigger than I expected. The shared kitchen across the hall is convenient and has pretty much anything you need except a large enough table if you have more than two people. However there is so much room in your private living room or there is also space out on the enclosed porch down the hall to sit. The downstairs porch is also very nice but I didn't make time to sit out there.
The location is great and the small restaurant across the street has some good breakfast burritos. A big plus is that it's walking distance to the the shops and restaurants on Bullard St. and the local farmers market on Saturday. I would definitely stay here again.

It was clean and bright with lots of towels and the bed was very comfortable. It was located just off the main part of town which was very pretty with lots of big trees. Our rooms had tons of light and we were able to leave the windows open and hear the birds in the morning. There’s a funky little restaurant across the street that we went to for breakfast. We ate several of our meals on the upper porch. If I return to Silver City I would certainly stay there again.

review_text: We were travelling with another couple and this was a perfect place to stay. Thompson House is a beautifully restored home and they have created at least 3 rooms that can be rented. We were in Suite 2. It had a couch and 2 chairs in one room and a bed in the next room with huge windows. Loved all the light. The house and rooms were very well decorated. I want her to come help me with mine! There is a common sitting room in the front of the house and a kitchen area with coffee and tea. There is a mini fridge in the suite and a bigger fridge in the kitchen. We walked downtown to several restaurants. There are many art galleries near by . Some had odd hours and weren't open while we were there. We used this as our base for the Gila Cliff Dwelling adventure.
